instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Hi I got this board and it has no green light PP3V42 .9v I found a cap <CAPACITOR>C5002</CAPACITOR> shorted and removed it :/ I didn’t find corrosion around smc. It looks like it’s been tossed around parts are knocked off and <CHIP>U2940</CHIP> is cracked. I don’t have this size caps or a donor board yet i need to order one is the TPS22920YZPR from digikey compatible ? Also Same question for <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> from digikey

At L7095 Before removing cap
5 ohm
Diode mode
.06v

after removing

47k Ohms
diode mode .313v

Can I power it on without this cap ? Is it critical?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
You can test without that cap.
Do you have <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
3.42v .I have a green light and All rails are present. I also have fan spin. 
so my other two questions.TPS22920YZPR from digikey compatible ? Also Same question for <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> from digikey I’m ordering some parts from the for another project and was wondering if these chips are compatible? Or just wait for a donor board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Just be sure to get same case for <CHIP>TPS22920</CHIP>; don't worry about rest of code.
